content.description: Shipwreck Slab is a great route for new leaders. It has nicely spaced bolts and fairly easy moves.
content.location:
It is on the far left side of the wall next to

Come Shale Away

.

content.description: This fun line was squeezed in to provide climbers an introduction to steeper climbing and small roofs. Start on the steep broken face, and make your way to a mini-roof that will push you to use your feet. Mount this, and scramble up easy climbing to the anchor.
content.protection: 4 Bolts to a two bolt anchor.
content.location: This is the rightmost bolted line on the wall. The “boot” hold is right at the bottom of the route.

climbs.name: Jolly Roger
climbs.fa: Alex Morano, Gray Wasson, and Jack Jones

content.description: Start with some cool moves on the unique holds down low. After passing over the lower section, run up the super easy slab to the anchors. I put this route in as an easy warm-up and maybe a route to play hold elimination on.
content.location: It is the left route on the broken lower face by the upturned tree and is second to the right on the entire wall.

content.description: This route is a blast with hard moves from the start. Mount the first steep section, then continue up easy climbing to wide arete that will lead you to the anchors.
content.protection:
4-5 Bolts. This shares anchors with

Black Pearl

.
content.location: This is the first bolted line on the main face of the wall.

content.description: This is the hardest route at the cliff. Thin climbing down low will force you to find good footholds to slowly make yourself inch up the wall. Once over the initial steep section, the climbing eases and leads to the anchors.
content.location:
It is just right of

Black Pearl

.

content.description:
Come Shale Away is a fun, stout, & sketchy climb on high quality stone that seemed too short to bolt.

Begin in the small alcove, & use incut crimps to get right up against the looming slab. Steady yourself to reach up & right to good holds. Work the top right edge as high as you can, then do a "saddle up" move to gain the south face. Top out. Beware of the death spike!

Alternatively, one could set up an extended TR on the trees above for a 5.10ish experience.
content.location: On the far left side of the wall, ascend the obvious, dark, overhanging face that looks like a sail.

content.description: Start with hard moves off the ground to the crux at the bulge. Surmount the steep section using a cool Side-pull. The route eases up near the top. This route shares anchors with the route to the left.
content.location: It is the second farthest left route on the main wall. Start low, and follow the bolts.

content.description: This is an easy climb with one tricky move at the bottom requiring good footwork. After this, it’s jugs and easy going to the top.  This is a great beginner lead as the bolts are close together and the climbing is very secure.
content.location:
It is between

Flying Dutchman

and

Jolly Roger

.
